ResourceHeader.ResourceName: ACE SIS 1-Hour Level 2 Key Parameter Data
ResourceHeader.Description:
ACE Solar Isotope Spectrometer (SIS) hourly intensities and count rates, for each of 14 elements 
        (He,C,N,O,Ne,Na,Mg,Al,Si,S,Ar,Ca,Fe,Ni).in each of 8 energy bins.  Overall energy ranges covered go from 3.4-41 MeV/n 
        for helium to 10.5-168 MeV/n for iron.  These are calibrated science quality data.  The data are accessible via ftp in 
        HDF and CDF from the ACE Science Center and CDAWeb, respectively, and in ASCII format from the value-added interfaces at 
        those sites.  The "parameter keys" given below are as used by CDAWeb.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the ACE/SIS instrument team and the ACE Science Center

NumericalData.ProviderResourceName: ACE SIS Level 2 Key Parameter Data, 1-hour averages
NumericalData.Caveats:
The quality of ACE level 2 data is such that it is suitable for serious scientific study. 
      However, to avoid confusion and misunderstanding, it is recommended that users consult with the appropriate 
      ACE team members before publishing work derived from the data. The ACE team has worked hard to ensure that 
      the level 2 data are free from errors, but the team cannot accept responsibility for erroneous data, or for 
      misunderstandings about how the data may be used. This is especially true if the appropriate ACE team members 
      are not consulted before publication. At the very least, preprints should be forwarded to the ACE team before publication.

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Description: Number of milliseconds since CDF_EPOCH: 0000-01-01T00:00:00.000. Timestamp marks beginning of interval

Parameter.Name: Time PB5
Parameter.Description: Time of observation in year, day of year, and milliseconds. Timestamp marks beginning of interval

Parameter.Name: H Particle Flux (>10 MeV)
Parameter.Caveats:
Proton Flux E>10 MeV - During solar quiet times, these fluxes are contaminated by background from particles entering 
        from the sides of the instrument.

Parameter.Name: H Particle Flux (>30 MeV)
Parameter.Caveats:
Proton Flux E>30 MeV - During solar quiet times, these fluxes are contaminated by background from particles entering 
        from the sides of the instrument.

Parameter.Name: C, N, O Particle Flux (7-10 MeV/n)
Parameter.Description: C, N, O Particle Flux (7-10 MeV/n)
Parameter.Caveats:
Note that the energy intervals for the most abundant elements C, N, and O all differ somewhat 
        from the nominal values of 7 to 10 MeV/nuc.

Parameter.Name: C, N, O Particle Flux (10-15 MeV/n)
Parameter.Description: C, N, O Particle Flux (10-15 MeV/n)
Parameter.Caveats:
Note that the energy intervals for the most abundant elements C, N, and O all differ somewhat 
        from the nominal values of 10 to 15 MeV/nuc.

Parameter.Name: Z>10 Particle Flux (9-21 MeV/n)
Parameter.Caveats:
Note that the quoted energy interval of ~9 to 21 MeV/nuc is strictly valid only for Si. For Ne the 
        corresponding interval is ~8 to ~17 MeV/nuc, while for Fe it is ~12 to ~26 MeV/nuc.
